thread.title: Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts
thread.title_full: Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts

author: USA TODAY
title: Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts
text:
Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts Federal regulators ordered a recall Thursday of the Britax click-and-go mounts on stroller frames because they sometimes disconnect from car seats, allowing a child to fall. Post to Facebook Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts Federal regulators ordered a recall Thursday of the Britax click-and-go mounts on stroller frames because they sometimes disconnect from car seats, allowing a child to fall.   USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lbowyg   Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Britax strollers recalled for failed car-seat mounts Bart Jansen , USA TODAY Published 10:12 a.m. ET Feb. 16, 2017 | Updated 16 minutes ago Britax B-Agile strollers have been recalled because click-and-go mounts on the frame sometimes allow children to call when attached to a car seat, the Consumer Product Safety Commission announced Feb. 16, 2017. (Photo: Courtesty: Britax) 1 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON – The Britax click-and-go mounts on its stroller frames have been recalled because they sometimes disconnect from car seats, allowing a child to fall, the Consumer Product Safety Commission announced Thursday. 
About 676,000 of the strollers have been sold, according to the commission, along with 36,400 in Canada and 4,600 in Mexico. 
Britax said in a statement that an investigation found that damage to the stroller frame could occur when it is stowed or dropped while the click-and-go receivers are attached. #Recall : @Britax B-Agile, BOB Motion strollers w/Click & Go receivers; Fall hazard; Free remedy https://t.co/TVKA0NBrBq pic.twitter.com/C96liGrNx5 — U.S. CPSC (@USCPSC) February 16, 2017 
The company urged consumers to stop using the B-Agile and BOB Motion strollers in cars, but said they were safe to use a stroller as a recliner for an infant. 
The company told consumers not to return the product to the retailer, but to dispose of the click-and-go receivers. For a single stroller, the company is providing a remedy kit to fix the broken part. 
More information is available from the company can be contacted at us.britax.com/recall or at 844-227-0300 from 8:30 a.m.to 7 p.m. Eastern time on weekdays and 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Saturday.
